# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the `wrap_string` function written in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            result *= line * "\n"
            line = word
        else
            if !isempty(line)
                line *= " "
            end
            line *= word
        end
    end
    
    result *= line  # Add the last line
    return result
end
```

An example of using `wrap_string`:

```julia
example_text = "Julia language is a high-level, high-performance language."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(example_text)

println(wrapped_text)
```

This would result in something like:

```
Julia
language
is a
high-level,
high-perform
ance
language.
```

The exact output might differ slightly depending on the length of words and the specified `text_width`.
